title: 108_s862
content: The "Adoption Equality Act of 2003" emphasizes the importance of providing permanent homes for children in foster care. Despite the increase in adoptions, there are still approximately 131,000 children waiting to be adopted. The "Adoption Equality Act of 2003" aims to provide permanent homes for children in foster care. Section 473(a) of the Social Security Act is amended to ensure that children in the care of child placement agencies meet eligibility requirements for supplemental security. The "Adoption Equality Act of 2003" aims to provide permanent homes for children in foster care by amending Section 473(a) of the Social Security Act to ensure eligibility for supplemental security income benefits for children in foster care or child care institutions with special needs. The "Adoption Equality Act of 2003" aims to provide permanent homes for children in foster care by ensuring eligibility for adoption assistance payments for children who meet specific requirements, regardless of citizenship or residency status. The "Adoption Equality Act of 2003" ensures eligibility for adoption assistance payments for children in foster care, even if they are not citizens or residents of the United States and were adopted internationally. The "Adoption Equality Act of 2003" requires states to use savings from reduced expenditures on services for children or families after failed adoptions to provide post-adoption services. Additionally, it amends the determination of a child with special needs under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to specify criteria for a child to be considered as having special needs, including being unable to return home or meeting medical/disability requirements for supplemental security income benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to specify criteria for a child to be considered as having special needs, including factors like medical conditions or handicaps that make it necessary to provide adoption assistance and medical assistance. Efforts must be made to place the child with adoptive parents before providing assistance, unless it is not in the child's best interests. The amendments made by this section regarding adoption and medical assistance shall take effect on October 1, 2003.
